Process Manhattan plot input into standardized data frame

Source: R/helpers.R
process_manhattan_input.Rd

This function converts any input type (data.frame or named list) into a standardized data frame with consistent columns for Manhattan plot visualization.

Usage

process_manhattan_input(
  input,
  chr = "CHR",
  bp = "BP",
  p = "P",
  snp = "SNP",
  track_labels = NULL
)

Arguments

input

Either a data frame or named list of data frames

chr

Column name for chromosome (default: "CHR")

bp

Column name for base pair position (default: "BP")

p

Column name for p-value (default: "P")

snp

Column name for SNP identifier (default: "SNP")

track_labels

Optional vector of track labels (used for unnamed list input)

Value

A data frame with standardized columns and optionally track column

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
# Data frame input
df <- data.frame(CHR = 1, BP = 1:100, P = runif(100), SNP = paste0("rs", 1:100))
process_manhattan_input(df)

# List input
data_list <- list("GWAS1" = df1, "GWAS2" = df2)
process_manhattan_input(data_list)
} # }
